Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different plants and animals, including humans, in their natural habitats.
The student can label the places where different plants and animals live (e.g., forests, lakes, fields).
The student can include what plants and animals need to survive, like water, sunlight, and food, in their drawings.
The student can show how the animals and plants are connected to the materials and resources they need (e.g., fish in water, deer in a forest).
The student can illustrate the relationships between where plants and animals live and the resources those environments provide.
The student can use their drawings to demonstrate how plants and animals, their homes, and resources are all part of a system working together.
